value.name: San Diego Sheriff’s Deputy Is Charged With Second-Degree Murder
value.description: Sheriff’s Deputy Aaron Russell, 23, is accused of fatally shooting an unarmed man, Nicholas Bils, 36, in the back.

value.name: Warrant says why San Diego deputy faces murder charger after shooting unarmed detainee
value.description: Three other law enforcement officers didn't perceive Nicholas Bils an imminent threat when Aaron Russell fatally shot him

value.name: A police officer fatally shot an unarmed, mentally ill man. He’s now charged with murder.
value.description: When Nicholas Bils, a 36-year-old with a history of severe mental illness, escaped from custody and fled along a downtown San Diego street in May, he was unarmed. Yet moments after a pair of ...

value.name: Former San Diego Sheriff's deputy who fatally shot man escaping custody charged with second degree murder
value.description: Aaron Russell is slated to be arraigned Tuesday in connection with the shooting death of 36-year-old Nicholas Bils.

value.name: Ex-San Diego Deputy Charged With Murder in Escapee Shooting
value.description: A former San Diego County Sheriff’s Department deputy accused of shooting and killing a mentally ill man who had escaped custody outside the downtown jail in May has been charged with second-degree murder,

value.name: Former San Diego deputy charged with murder in shooting of mentally ill man
value.description: A former San Diego County Sheriff’s Department deputy who allegedly fatally shot a mentally ill man who had escaped custody in May has been charged with second-degree murder.

provider.name: New York Daily News on MSN.com

value.name: Former San Diego sheriff's deputy charged with murder in detainee shooting pleads not guilty
value.description: Aaron Russell, 23, is charged in the death of 36-year-old Nicholas Bils, who was unarmed and running away from officers when he was shot.

value.name: Legal Claims Mount on San Diego, La Mesa Police; Use of Force Called Excessive
value.description: A series of legal cases and claims were announced Thursday against various San Diego-area law enforcement agencies and jurisdictions stemming from recent alleged instances of excessive force against detainees and protesters.
